data.title: Mike Brewer gives the biggest clue yet on Edd China Wheeler Dealers return
data.meta_description: Wheeler Dealers star Mike Brewer has opened up on Edd China in a revealing 30-minute Q&A ahead of the latest TV series.
data.text:
Wheeler Dealers host Mike Brewer has made crystal clear when Edd China will return to the popular classic car restoration show in a major admission.

Mike, host of the show for more than 20 years, revealed Edd would not be returning to the series despite demands for the duo to reunite.

He stressed Edd coming back was “not happening” and urged fans angered by the move to switch off completely.

Mike and Edd started the show together back in 2003 and were on an on-screen double act for almost 15 years.

However, Edd and Mike parted ways back in 2017 with Ant Anstead and Marc Priestley taking over co-host duties.

READ MORE Mike Brewer lists used car picks for under £5,000 including Vauxhall and Ford

Mike made the latest remark in a 30-minute Q&A on the Wheeler Dealers Facebook page on Sunday evening.

Wife Michelle was asking Mike a series of questions sent in by fans of the show ahead of the new series of Wheeler Dealers World Tour.

Michelle asked: “This one, we are going to start with get it in and out and out the way. Lord Blair asks ‘When is Edd coming back? I never watch it’.

“So hold on Lord Blair, you must be watching it if you know he’s not in the show. How does that question work?”

Mike replied: “When is Edd coming back? He’s never coming back, simple as that.

DON'T MISS

Wheeler Dealers Mike Brewer on vital used car tip for 'less than a tank of fuel’ [LATEST]

Wheeler Dealers host Mike Brewer unveils simple fix for ‘dead’ classic cars [ANALYSIS]

Wheeler Dealers host Mike Brewer gives new update in hunt for stolen Ford Fiesta [COMMENT]

“So yeah, it's like me saying I really want Sean Connery to be [James] Bond again. It would be great wouldn’t it, Sean Connery as Bond but it’s not happening.

“Or it would be great if Tom Baker was Doctor Who, it isn’t happening.

“So no he's never coming back and if you don't like the fact he is never coming back don’t watch it. Simply don't watch it.

“Better still watch the old series, if you watch the old series, classic series where Edd was amazing, Go and watch that, it will be brilliant we love it.”

Invalid email

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

As Michelle started asking Mike the next question, the TV star quickly asked whether there were more Edd questions on the way.

He prevented any further discussion on the issue, adding: “Don't say if it's an Edd question I’m going to smash this computer.”

Edd walked away from the series after apparent disagreements over the future direction of the show.

Mike recently admitted he was no longer on speaking terms with Edd and suggested the last time they saw each other was seven years ago.
